question.text: State the function of the gap junction found in the epithelium.

options.text: Performing the job of adhesion to keep neighbouring cells together.
Enabling relay of substances between adjoining cells by connecting cytoplasm for rapid transfer of ions, small molecules.
Not allowing the cells to come in contact with each other.
Preventing leakage of substances over and around tissue.

solution.text:
Epithelial tissue are the type of tissue found in animal, which provide a lining or covering over other parts of the body. These tissues have certain connecting links, which give structural as well as functional support called as junctions. There are three types:
1. Tight junctions: They are present between cells. They support to prevent any leaks of material which is not required across the tissue and also in a way keep cells separate.
2. Adhering junctions: As the name suggests, they do the job of adhesion between cells, keeping it together.
3. Gap junctions: They are found in epithelial tissue and provide transport of material, viz., ions transport, small molecules, water etc., between adjacent cells.
